Text:
...It seems like you've managed to obtain solid
intel.

So it's true then, the Cult has tampered with
Sergey's history within the Oriana Kingdom.

...To put it plainly, it's not just Sergey we're
talking about.
You mean...?!
Could you provide us with more details?

...Let's start with the gap in Sergey's history
within the Oriana Kingdom that Beta had
previously investigated—

The vineyard where he was raised, along with all
public records related to it, simply doesn't exist.

However, we've verified that they did exist in the
past, even though they've been removed from the
records.

It's implausible for the Cult to have collected
every single bottle of wine that was ever shipped
out all over the world...

While tracing the source of that wine, we
discovered...that the Gorman farm did
indeed exist.
I see. You're quite the detective...!
Heh... I prefer spy over detective.

...Public records appear to have been altered about
a week after Sergey defeated the former Seven Blades.
The swiftness is remarkable, far too quick for typical
bureaucratic processes.
So, the the Cult's influence is evident, then?

It's as if the entire Oriana Kingdom is bowing to
the Cult... That's the emerging hypothesis.

I dug into similar cases within the Oriana Kingdom—
and hit a goldmine. I've compiled the intel into
concise documents. Take a look.
Perv Asshat...?

The second son of the Duke Asshat family is...
adopted? Why would a duke's family, especially
one that has a firstborn son, adopt a child?

The fact that everything about Perv's background
before he was adopted by the Asshat family has
been wiped clean is extremely suspicious, don't
you think?
*gasp*

Furthermore, in a relatively short period after his
adoption, Perv managed to infiltrate the heart of
the Oriana Kingdom.
Could this Perv Asshat possibly be...!

It's natural to suspect him as a pawn sent by the
Cult, especially when we take Sergey's case into
account—

It's only logical to presume that the Cult has some
degree of influence over personnel matters and
public record decisions within the Oriana Kingdom.

Perv Asshat himself is rumored to be highly skilled
with a sword, which is exceptional in the Oriana
Kingdom where artistic talent is highly prized.

In other words, there's a possibility that he might
be a high-ranking operative of the Children, sent
into an aristocrat family of the kingdom as an adopted
child by the Cult.
No, it can't be...!

That would mean the politicians and aristocrats of
the Oriana Kingdom are practically puppets of the
Cult of Diablos!

...Much like the Herzog family in the Velgalta
Empire, aristocrats with ties to the Cult are
effectively reigning as rulers...

The darkness cast by the Cult enveloping the world
runs deep...! It appears that even the Midgard
Kingdom is not immune to its influence.
...What about Sergey's recent movements?

He's been meddling and causing trouble for Annerose
with the soldiers under his influence.

But Annerose is quite skilled, and with the
protection of No. 111 and No. 122, he hasn't
been able to achieve his objective—I believe
Gamma reported that much already.

...As a result, there's widespread speculation
within Velgalta that the Herzog Family massacre and
Lady Karen's disappearance are part of a conspiracy.

The article about Annerose's investigation that Beta
had the MNA write up seems to be having an impact.
Heheh... Glad to hear that!

If we continue on this course, feeding the intel
that the Garden has on Sergey to Annerose's
investigation...

We can expose the Cult's movements by bringing
Sergey down in the public eye as Gamma planned.

There are also a few unverified rumors that haven't
been confirmed yet, so their relevance remains
uncertain.
What kind of rumors?

...Sergey never dines with anyone, reportedly
because of his "strict physical conditioning."
Also, he never removes his armor in public.

And...there have been multiple sightings of him in
Madlid, separate from his pursuit of Lady Karen.
That's about it.
In Madlid...?

Normally, it's not a place he would have business
in, would he?

That's what I thought, so I investigated the region
around Madlid, but I couldn't find any connections.
It's a region with no known ties to Sergey.
Where did these sightings originate from?

Whenever Sergey is spotted in Madlid, it seems
he's always engaged in battles against Malak the
Malevolent.

He only repels it's attacks, though, and never
manages to completely drive off Malak.

...There might be a specific reason why Sergey is so
fixated on Madlid and Malak.

If his goal was merely to battle formidable
monsters, it seems there would be other options...

Indeed, and since only Sergey appears to aware of
the reason, it might be a useful bait to lure him to
Madlid.
Well, I'll delve further into this matter.
Thank you, Zeta. Please keep up the good work.
...That said...
Lady Alpha...?

...The outskirts of Madlid in Velgalta... That's
where Shadow guided Gamma and Eta to
investigate...!
Indeed, the entire incident originated there!

Could Master Shadow have foreseen this sequence of
events from the very start...?
That may be the case... No, it must be...!

Even when he's concealed in the shadows, his
watchful eyes are always surveying the world
at large...
